etymology.description: 𠂤 (mound, hill) + 帀 (to surround) = ancient troops stationed at a hill -> leader, master
etymology.interpretation: The character 師(師) (shī, 'master') combines a depiction of a mound or hill and the idea of surrounding, representing troops stationed around a hill, symbolizing command and leadership. This naturally extends to the concept of a 'master' or 'teacher'.
etymology.simplification: 师(師) simplified by removing additional strokes, preserving phonetic component.

examples.chinese: 他是一位优秀的师(他是一位優秀的師)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì yī wèi yōuxiù de shī.

examples.chinese: 学生敬重师(學生敬重師)，认真求学(認真求學)。
examples.english: Students respect their teacher and study diligently.

examples.chinese: 他拜访名师(他拜訪名師)，虚心求教(虛心求教)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bàifǎng míng shī, xūxīn qiújiào.
examples.english: He visits a renowned master and earnestly seeks advice.
